layout.singingstanza: Be -- hold how good a thing It is to dwell in peace; How pleas -- ing to our King, This fruit of right -- eous -- ness; When breth -- ren all in one a -- gree, They know the joy of u -- ni -- ty! They know the joy of u -- ni -- ty!

lyrics.stanza: Where unity is found, The sweet anointing grace Extends to all around, And shines from every face; To every praising saint it comes, And fills him with divine perfumes.
On all His chosen ones The precious oil comes down: Anointing as it runs, Anointing on and on. E'en to His skirts (the meanest name That longs to love the bleeding Lamb).
From Aaron's beard it rolls, (Those nearest to His face), The humble, trembling souls Who know abundant grace; The grace, the grace for all is free, For, lo, it reaches now to me!
(Repeat the last line of each stanza)
